course_description: Learn the fundamentals of Python programming, from syntax to basic problem-solving. Build hands-on skills through practical examples and small projects designed for beginners.
course_overview: This beginner-level course introduces Python programming concepts including variables, data types, control flow, functions, and file handling. Students will explore core programming principles through guided exercises and real-world applications, culminating in the creation of simple scripts and programs. The curriculum balances theory with practice, preparing learners for intermediate programming studies or entry-level coding roles.
target_audience: Aspiring programmers, students, and professionals with no prior coding experience seeking a foundational understanding of Python.
learning_outcomes: Write and execute basic Python scripts
Design programs using conditional statements and loops
Debug common syntax and logic errors
Implement functions and modular code structures
Explain the use of core Python data types (strings, lists, dictionaries)
Create simple applications combining multiple programming concepts
